newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait says its troops on full alert.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait says its troops on full alert.

text.p: Kuwait's defence minister said in remarks published on Wednesday that the Gulf Arab state's military was on full alert to face any "reckless action" like a Scud missile attack by former occupier Iraq.

Sheikh Ahmad Hamoud al-Jaber al-Sabah said Kuwaiti forces "are on the highest state of alert to face any aggression or reckless action that the head of the Iraqi regime could take against Kuwait," al-Anba newspaper reported.
The United States has fired 44 cruise missiles at targets in southern Iraq since early on Tuesday.
"We have placed a plan for this stage," he said, adding that precautions were taken to address any Iraqi Scud missile attack.
Kuwait has a small military force of about 15,000 men compared to Iraq's 400,000-strong force. Since the 1991 Gulf War Kuwait has deployed Patriot anti-missile systems.
Asked if Kuwait plans to call up reserve troops Sheikh Ahmad said: "I don't think we have reached such a stage, but whenever we reach it we will summon the reserve forces."
Al-Seyassah newspaper quoted Sheikh Ahmad as saying: "The situation on the Kuwaiti-Iraqi border is extremely quiet and there are no extraordinary movements."
